critique: This document is an executive order approving a Code of Fair Competition for the Photo-Engraving Industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act of 1933. This act was part of FDR's New Deal program. The document reflects a strong interventionist approach to the economy, with the government setting standards for competition and labor practices. It also centralizes power at the federal level, as the code is federally mandated and enforced. There is a slight tilt towards social inclusion by attempting to ensure fair labor practices and work sharing. There is no clear indication about immigration, security vs liberty, or executive power. The ideological tilt is towards liberal due to the interventionist economic policies.
